titles.title: Wrecked Outright On Jesus' Breast (little work

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Wrecked outright on Jesus' breast Only wrecked souls thus can sing Little boats that hug the shore Fearing what the storm may bring Never find on Jesus' breast All that wrecked souls mean by rest{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Wrecked outright - So we lament But when storms have done their worst Then the soul surviving all In Eternal arms is nursed There to find that nought can move One embosomed in such love{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Wrecked outright - No more to own E'en a craft to sail the sea Still a voyager yet now Anchored to Infinity Nothing left to do but fling Care aside and simply cling{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Wrecked outright - 'Twas purest gain Henceforth other craft can see That the storm may be a boon That however rough the sea God Himself doth watchful stand For the wreck is in His hand{/lang-eng}
